alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Warren (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 2:57PM CDT until May 09 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in St Louis MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Missouri River at Washington. Bourbeuse River at Union. Meramec River near Eureka. Meramec River at Pacific. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Missouri River at Washington. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Wastewater plant turns pumps on. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 18.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to 22.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday evening to 19.4 feet and begin rising again early Monday morning. It will rise to 19.5 feet Monday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg 1 pm Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue Missouri River Washington 20.0 18.6 21.7 20.7 19.4 19.4 MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Rainfall heavier than forecast could cause river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The National Weather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
